original_instructions:
Marinate the shrimp in the lime juice for one hour. Drain and reserve the juice. In a large bowl combine the shrimp, tomatillos, green onions, jalapenos, garlic, cilantro, avocados, salt and pepper and toss to coat.
Serve immediately.
ingredients: 1 pound cooked, cleaned shrimp, chopped in 1/4 inch dice
1/4 pound tomatillos, husks removed and diced
1 small avocado, peeled and pit removed

step_by_step_instructions: Marinate the shrimp in the lime juice for one hour.
Drain the shrimp and reserve the lime juice.
In a large bowl, combine the shrimp, tomatillos, green onions, jalapenos, garlic, cilantro, avocados, salt, and pepper.
Toss the mixture to coat all ingredients.
Serve immediately.

recipe_title: Oven Roasted Cinnamon Sweet Potato Fries
original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Place a heavy duty sheet tray into the oven to heat.
Add the sweet potatoes to a large bowl and drizzle with the olive oil. Season with the cinnamon, cumin, salt and pepper.
Spread out on the hot sheet tray and bake until crisp, 25 to 30 minutes. Flip the fries halfway through roasting.
ingredients: 2 large (about 1 1/2 pounds) sweet potatoes, peeled & cut into thin fries
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Place a heavy duty sheet tray into the oven to heat.
Add the sweet potatoes to a large bowl and drizzle with the olive oil.
Season with the cinnamon, cumin, salt and pepper.
Spread out the sweet potatoes on the hot sheet tray.
Bake until crisp, 25 to 30 minutes, flipping the fries halfway through roasting.

recipe_title: Garlic and Sun-Dried Tomato Corn Muffin
original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Grease 2 muffin tins.
In a large bowl combine the muffin mix, corn, garlic, and sun-dried tomatoes. Stir to combine. In a small bowl whisk together the buttermilk, sour cream, and eggs until well blended. Add the buttermilk mixture to the muffin mix. Stir to combine. Spoon the mix into the muffin tins, filling up the cups about halfway. Bake until golden brown on top, about 15 minutes.
ingredients: 2 cups frozen whole kernel corn, thawed
2/3 cup diced sun-dried tomatoes (from an 8-ounce jar)

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
Grease 2 muffin tins.
In a large bowl combine the muffin mix, corn, garlic, and sun-dried tomatoes.
Stir to combine.
In a small bowl whisk together the buttermilk, sour cream, and eggs until well blended.
Add the buttermilk mixture to the muffin mix.
Stir to combine.
Spoon the mix into the muffin tins, filling up the cups about halfway.
Bake until golden brown on top, about 15 minutes.

original_instructions: Put the couscous in a medium bowl; pour the hot stock over it and stir to combine. Cover and let sit for 10 to 15 minutes. Uncover and fluff with a fork. Add the apricots, scallions, and orange juice; drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Toss gently to combine. Garnish with chopped parsley.
ingredients: 2 scallions, sliced thin, green parts only
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley leaves, for garnish

step_by_step_instructions: Put the couscous in a medium bowl.
Pour the hot stock over the couscous and stir to combine.
Cover the bowl and let it sit for 10 to 15 minutes.
Uncover the bowl and fluff the couscous with a fork.
Add the chopped apricots, sliced scallions, and orange juice to the couscous.
Drizzle the mixture with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Toss the ingredients gently to combine.
Garnish with chopped parsley.

recipe_title: Variations on Stuffing 101: Sausage and Apple Stuffing
original_instructions: In a large non-stick skillet over medium heat, cook 1 pound bulk pork sausage, breaking up the meat with a spoon, until cooked through, about 10 minutes. Add to the Bread Stuffing 101 along with the dried apples.

step_by_step_instructions: Place a large non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Add 1 pound of bulk pork sausage to the skillet.
Cook the sausage, breaking up the meat with a spoon, until cooked through. This will take about 10 minutes.
Add the cooked sausage and chopped dried apples to the Bread Stuffing 101 mixture.

original_instructions:
In a small saucepan, melt butter. When foaming subsides, stir in flour and cook, stirring continuously for about a minute or two. Whisk in the milk, bring to a boil and simmer for 5 minutes. Add horseradish, mustard and vinegar and remove from heat. Stir in sour cream and season with salt and pepper.
In a small saucepan, melt butter. When foaming subsides, stir in flour and cook, stirring continuously for about a minute or two. Whisk in the milk, bring to a boil and simmer for 5 minutes. Add horseradish, mustard and vinegar and remove from heat. Stir in sour cream and season with salt and pepper.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
Salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: In a small saucepan, melt butter until the foaming subsides.
Stir in flour and cook, stirring continuously for about a minute or two.
Whisk in the milk, bring the mixture to a boil, and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add horseradish, mustard, and vinegar, then remove from heat.
Stir in sour cream and season with salt and pepper.

recipe_title: Black-Eyed Pea Salad with Canadian Bacon
original_instructions:
Spray a large nonstick skillet with canola oil spray and heat over medium-high heat. Add the bacon and cook until very lightly browned, about 3 minutes per side. Cool slightly and cut into thin strips.
Whisk together the vinegar, olive oil and salt and pepper to taste in a large bowl. Add the carrots, peas and scallions and toss. Add the watercress and toss again. Transfer to a large platter and top with the bacon.
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
One 15-ounce can no-salt-added black-eyed peas, rinsed and drained
1 bunch watercress, trimmed and separated into sprigs

step_by_step_instructions: Spray a large nonstick skillet with canola oil spray and heat over medium-high heat.
Add the bacon and cook until very lightly browned, about 3 minutes per side.
Cool slightly and cut into thin strips.
Whisk together the vinegar, olive oil, and salt and pepper to taste in a large bowl.
Add the carrots, peas, and scallions and toss.
Add the watercress and toss again.
Transfer to a large platter and top with the bacon.

original_instructions:
Peel 1 medium kohlrabi or turnip and cut into matchsticks. Whisk the juice of 1/2 lemon, 1/4 cup chopped dill, 1/2 clove minced garlic, 1 teaspoon dijon mustard, and salt and pepper in a bowl; whisk in 3 tablespoons olive oil. Toss with the kohlrabi, 1/4 head shredded Savoy cabbage, and salt and pepper to taste.
Photograph by Antonis Achilleos

step_by_step_instructions: Peel 1 medium kohlrabi.
Cut the kohlrabi into matchsticks.
Whisk the juice of 1/2 lemon, 1/4 cup chopped dill, 1/2 clove minced garlic, and 1 teaspoon dijon mustard in a bowl.
Add salt and pepper to the bowl and whisk in 3 tablespoons olive oil.
Toss the kohlrabi with the dressing, 1/4 head shredded cabbage, and add salt and pepper to taste.

original_instructions: In a large ball jar (or other transporting container), mix together the tea, lemon juice, and grenadine. Pour over ice when ready to serve.
ingredients: 1/4 cup fresh lemon juice (1 to 2 lemons)

step_by_step_instructions: In a large ball jar or other transporting container, mix together the tea, lemon juice, and grenadine.
Pour the mixture over ice when ready to serve.

original_instructions: Cut the carrots into strips and saute all of the ingredients until soft. Add the Monterrey and Jack cheeses, mix together with a plain white sauce and top with piped Yukon gold potatoes. Bake for 30 minutes at 425 degrees F.

step_by_step_instructions: Cut the carrots into strips.
Saute the carrots, broccoli, mushrooms, onion, and garlic in butter until soft.
Add the Monterrey and Jack cheeses to the vegetables.
Mix together the cheese and vegetable mixture with a plain white sauce.
Pipe Yukon gold potatoes on top of the mixture.
Bake the entire dish for 30 minutes at 425 degrees F.

recipe_title: Quick Broiled Flank Steak with Quick Roasted Veggies
original_instructions:
Preheat oven broiler. Marinate flank steak in lime juice, salt and pepper. Do this right on the paper the steak comes wrapped in for easy clean up. Place on broiler pan and cook, turning once until medium rare, about 4 to 5 minutes per side. Remove to a cutting board to rest.
Preheat oven to 475 degrees F.
Toss broccoli and cauliflower with olive salt and pepper, pour onto a cookie sheet in a single layer. Roast, turning once, until tender and cooked through, about 10 to 12 minutes.
Slice flank steak into thin strips, serve 3 to 4 ounces per person with a side of the veggies.
ingredients: 1 1/2 pound flank steak or the smallest one they'll sell you
Coarse salt and cracked black pepper
1/2 bunch broccoli, peeled, cut into florets
2 cobs shucked corn, cut into 2-inch slices

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven broiler.
Marinate the flank steak in lime juice, salt, and pepper, doing this directly on the wrapping paper for easy cleanup.
Place the marinated steak on a broiler pan.
Cook under the broiler, turning once, until medium rare, which takes about 4 to 5 minutes per side.
Remove the steak from the broiler and let it rest on a cutting board.
Preheat the oven to 475 degrees F.
Toss broccoli and cauliflower with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Arrange the broccoli and cauliflower on a cookie sheet in a single layer.
Roast in the preheated oven, turning once, until tender and cooked through, about 10 to 12 minutes.
Slice the rested flank steak into thin strips.
Serve 3 to 4 ounces of sliced steak per person with a side of roasted vegetables.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Peel and devein the shrimp. Place them on a sheet pan with the olive oil, 1 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper and toss together. Spread the shrimp on one layer and roast for 6 to 8 minutes, just until pink, firm and cooked through. Allow to cool for 3 minutes.
Meanwhile, make the sauce. In a large bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, orange zest, orange juice, vinegar, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. When the shrimp are cool, add them to the sauce and toss. Add the dill, capers, and red onion and toss well. The flavors will improve if you allow the salad to sit at room temperature for 30 minutes. Otherwise, chill and serve at room temperature.
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Peel and devein the shrimp.
Place the shrimp on a sheet pan with the olive oil, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper, and toss together.
Spread the shrimp in one layer and roast in the oven for 6 to 8 minutes until pink, firm, and cooked through.
Allow the shrimp to cool for 3 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a large bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, orange zest, orange juice, vinegar, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper to make the sauce.
When the shrimp are cool, add them to the sauce and toss.
Add the dill, capers, and red onion to the mixture and toss well.
Allow the salad to sit at room temperature for 30 minutes to improve the flavors, otherwise, chill and serve at room temperature.

recipe_title: Smoked Salmon Rounds with Black Sesame Seeds
original_instructions:
Combine salmon, shallot, chives, lemon zest and black pepper in a silver bowl.
Lay out sesame seeds on a plate. With your hands, form smoked salmon balls about 3/4 inch in diameter. Roll in sesame seeds and place on serving platter.
Serve with a tiny dollop of sour cream.
ingredients: 1/2 lemon grated with micro plane or zester

step_by_step_instructions: Combine salmon, shallot, chives, lemon zest and black pepper in a silver bowl.
Lay out sesame seeds on a plate.
With your hands, form smoked salmon balls about 3/4 inch in diameter.
Roll the salmon balls in sesame seeds.
Place the sesame-coated salmon balls on a serving platter.
Serve with a tiny dollop of sour cream.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
In a large (10- to 12-inch) saute pan, cook the butter and onions on medium-low heat for 12 to 15 minutes, until the onions are lightly browned. Don't rush this step; it makes all the difference when the onions are well cooked.
Sprinkle the flour into the pan, whisk in, then add the salt and pepper. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the hot chicken stock and Cognac, and cook uncovered for 4 to 5 minutes, until thickened. Add the cream, if desired, and serve.
ingredients: 2 cups chicken stock, preferably homemade, heated

step_by_step_instructions: In a large (10- to 12-inch) saute pan, cook the butter and onions on medium-low heat for 12 to 15 minutes, until the onions are lightly browned.
Sprinkle the flour into the pan and whisk it in.
Add the salt and pepper.
Cook for 2 to 3 minutes.
Add the hot chicken stock and Cognac, and cook uncovered for 4 to 5 minutes, until thickened.
Add the cream, if desired, and serve.

original_instructions:
Place the rice in a large bowl and rinse under cold running water for 5 minutes. Drain and set aside.
Heat the oil in a medium heavy saucepan over medium low heat. Add the onion and saute until soft, but not brown, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and saute for 1 more minute to release the aromas. Add the peas, carrots and string beans, and cook slightly, about 2 minutes. Add boiling water and rice, cover tightly and simmer for 1520 minutes, or until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender. Stir with a fork and serve hot.
ingredients: 1/2 pound string beans, cut into small pieces

step_by_step_instructions: Place the rice in a large bowl and rinse under cold running water for 5 minutes.
Drain the rice and set aside.
Heat the oil in a medium heavy saucepan over medium low heat.
Add the onion and saute until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add the garlic and saute for 1 more minute to release the aromas.
Add the peas, carrots, and string beans, and cook for about 2 minutes.
Add boiling water and rice to the saucepan, cover tightly and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender.
Stir the rice with a fork and serve hot.

original_instructions: Whisk together the buttermilk, mayonnaise, chives, vinegar, sugar, lemon juice and 1/2 teaspoon each salt and pepper in a small bowl. Combine the walnuts, celery and apples in a separate large bowl. Pour three-quarters of the dressing over the celery-apple mixture and toss to coat. Let stand for 5 minutes at room temperature, then toss again. Adjust the seasoning as desired. Add the remaining dressing and toss again. Serve at room temperature.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon plus 2 teaspoons apple cider vinegar
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
8 ribs celery, sliced about 1/4 inch thick on the bias
2 Gala apples, skin on, cored and diced

step_by_step_instructions: Whisk together the buttermilk, mayonnaise, chives, vinegar, sugar, lemon juice, salt, and pepper in a small bowl.
Combine the walnuts, celery, and apples in a separate large bowl.
Pour three-quarters of the dressing over the celery-apple mixture and toss to coat.
Let stand for 5 minutes at room temperature, then toss again.
Adjust the seasoning as desired.
Add the remaining dressing and toss again.
Serve at room temperature.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
On a work surface lay out 3 sheets of phyllo dough, brushing lightly with butter in between sheets. Cut stacked sheets into four squares. Place 1-ounce of chocolate in the center of each square. Gather the four corners of the phyllo square up around the chocolate and twist together to form a "purse". Repeat process for each square and then the remaining phyllo sheets and chocolate. Transfer the purses to a baking sheet. Brush purses with remaining butter and sprinkle with granulated sugar. Bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown.
In a blender combine the raspberries, liqueur, and water and process until smooth. Add additional water, if necessary, to achieve desired consistency. Pass the puree through a sieve to remove the seeds.
Serve the phyllo purses warm with the raspberry puree.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons framboise, raspberry or other liqueur

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Lay out 3 sheets of phyllo dough on a work surface.
Brush the first sheet lightly with melted butter.
Place the second sheet on top and brush it with melted butter.
Place the third sheet on top and brush it with melted butter.
Cut the stacked sheets into four squares.
Place 1-ounce of chocolate in the center of each square.
Gather the four corners of the phyllo square up around the chocolate and twist together to form a purse.
Repeat the process for each square.
Continue this process for the remaining phyllo sheets and chocolate.
Transfer all the purses to a baking sheet.
Brush the purses with the remaining butter.
Sprinkle the purses with granulated sugar.
Bake in the oven for 10 minutes or until golden brown.
In a blender, combine raspberries, framboise, and water.
Process the mixture until smooth.
Add additional water, if necessary, to achieve desired consistency.
Pass the puree through a sieve to remove the seeds.
Serve the phyllo purses warm with the raspberry puree.

recipe_title: Tomato, Cucumber, and Red Pepper Relish
original_instructions: In a large bowl toss together the red pepper, cucumber, and tomato. Add the oil, vinegar, oregano, salt and pepper, and toss to combine.
ingredients: 1 red pepper, seeded and finely diced
1 English cucumber, seeded and finely diced
2 large tomatoes, seeded and finely diced

step_by_step_instructions: In a large bowl, toss together the red pepper, cucumber, and tomato.
Add the olive oil, balsamic vinegar, oregano, salt, and freshly ground black pepper.
Toss to combine all ingredients thoroughly.

original_instructions: Mix all ingredients in a salad bowl. Toss gently and season with salt and pepper. Serve at room temperature family style.
ingredients: 1 1/2 pounds juicy tomatoes, cut into wedges

step_by_step_instructions: Cut tomatoes into wedges.
Prepare other ingredients as necessary.
Mix all cut and prepared ingredients in a salad bowl.
Toss the ingredients gently.
Season the mixture with salt and pepper.
Serve the salad at room temperature family style.

original_instructions: In a heavy kettle cook onions, garlic, and tomatoes, covered, over moderately low heat, stirring occasionally, until onions are very soft, about 40 minutes. Force mixture through a food mill fitted with coarse disk into a bowl. In a cleaned kettle stir together puree, sugar, and vinegar, and simmer, uncovered, stirring frequently to prevent scorching, until reduced by half, about 20 minutes. Tie cloves, allspice, cinnamon, and celery seed in a cheesecloth bag and add to tomato mixture with mustard and paprika. Simmer mixture, stirring until very thick, about 10 minutes. Discard bag and season mixture with hot sauce and salt. Ketchup may be made 10 days ahead and chilled, covered.;

step_by_step_instructions: In a heavy kettle, cook chopped onions, chopped garlic, and drained whole tomatoes, covered, over moderately low heat, stirring occasionally until onions are very soft, about 40 minutes.
Force the mixture through a food mill fitted with a coarse disk into a bowl.
In the cleaned kettle, stir together the tomato puree, sugar, and cider vinegar. Simmer uncovered, stirring frequently to prevent scorching, until reduced by half, about 20 minutes.
Tie cloves, allspice, cinnamon stick, and celery seed in a cheesecloth bag and add to the tomato mixture along with dry mustard and paprika.
Simmer the mixture, stirring until very thick, about 10 minutes.
Discard the spice bag and season the mixture with hot sauce and salt to taste.

recipe_title: Sandwiches de Miga: Eggs and Roquefort Argentine Sandwich
original_instructions:
In a 2-quart pot, place the eggs. Cover with water by 2 inches and salt the water liberally. Bring the water to a boil and then cover, turn off the heat, and let sit for 8 minutes.
Grate the hard boiled eggs on a cheese grater. In a small bowl, combine the eggs, mayonnaise, and cheese. Adjust the seasoning of the egg mixture with hot sauce, salt, and pepper, to taste. Layer bread with egg mixture and serve as double decker sandwiches.
ingredients: 12 slices Argentine migas bread (sliced white bread, a couple days old, crusts removed can be used)

step_by_step_instructions: Place the eggs in a 2-quart pot.
Cover the eggs with water by 2 inches and salt the water liberally.
Bring the water to a boil.
Once boiling, cover the pot, turn off the heat, and let the eggs sit for 8 minutes.
Grate the hard boiled eggs using a cheese grater.
In a small bowl, combine the grated eggs, mayonnaise, and cheese.
Season the egg mixture with hot sauce, salt, and pepper to taste.
Layer the bread with the egg mixture to make double decker sandwiches.

original_instructions: Scrub potatoes to clean. Slice potatoes into large, fry-like strips. Add sliced potato to bowl and cover with water. In large pot or deep fryer heat oil to 375 degrees. Drain potatoes and pat with napkin until completely dry. Blanch potatoes by briefly plunging into oil and frying until brown and crispy. Reheat oil to 375 degrees. Add blanched potatoes to oil and cook until tender but not browned. Remove fries to paper towel to drain. Season and serve.

step_by_step_instructions: Scrub potatoes to clean.
Slice potatoes into large, fry-like strips.
Add sliced potatoes to a bowl and cover with water.
In a large pot or deep fryer, heat oil to 375 degrees.
Drain potatoes and pat with a napkin until completely dry.
Blanch potatoes by briefly plunging them into oil and frying until brown and crispy.
Reheat oil to 375 degrees.
Add blanched potatoes to oil and cook until tender but not browned.
Remove fries to paper towel to drain.
Season and serve.

original_instructions:
Stir the cornstarch and 1/4 cup stock in a small bowl until the mixture is smooth.
Heat the remaining stock, garlic powder, broccoli, carrots, pepper and onion in a 3-quart saucepan over medium heat to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Cover and cook for 5 minutes or until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
Stir in the cornstarch mixture. Cook and stir until the mixture boils and thickens. Stir in the turkey and cook until the mixture is hot and bubbling. Toss with the spaghetti and cheese.
Tip: To save time, you can use 2 cans (4.5 ounces each) Swanson® Premium White Chunk Chicken Breast in Water, drained, for the turkey in this recipe.
ingredients: 1/4 teaspoons garlic powder or 1 clove garlic, minced
1/2 cup green or red pepper cut into 2-inch long strips
2 cups cubed cooked turkey or chicken
1/2 of a 16 ounce package spaghetti, cooked without salt, and drained (about 4 cups)

step_by_step_instructions: Stir the cornstarch and 1/4 cup stock in a small bowl until the mixture is smooth.
Heat the remaining stock, garlic powder, broccoli, carrots, pepper, and onion in a 3-quart saucepan over medium heat to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low. Cover and cook for 5 minutes or until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
Stir in the cornstarch mixture.
Cook and stir until the mixture boils and thickens.
Stir in the turkey and cook until the mixture is hot and bubbling.
Toss with the spaghetti and cheese.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly grease a 12-cup muffin tin. Melt butter in a saucepan over low heat and set aside. Mix flour, baking powder and salt in medium bowl. In another bowl, whisk the egg, then add the sugar. Whisk until thick and thoroughly mixed. Continue to whisk, adding the milk and melted butter. Add the sour cream and stir to combine. Fold the egg mixture into the flour mixture until well combined. Add the chopped peaches and stir until just combined.
Drop tablespoons of the batter into the muffin tins until half full. Bake for 35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into a muffin comes out clean. Cool muffins in tins for 10 minutes, then turn them out onto a wire rack to finish cooling. Serve immediately or store in an airtight container for up to 2 days.
ingredients: 2 large, ripe peaches (to make 1 1/2 cups chopped peaches)

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Lightly grease a 12-cup muffin tin.
Melt butter in a saucepan over low heat and set aside.
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt in a medium bowl.
In another bowl, whisk the egg, then add the sugar.
Whisk until thick and thoroughly mixed.
Continue to whisk, adding the milk and melted butter.
Add the sour cream and stir to combine.
Fold the egg mixture into the flour mixture until well combined.
Add the chopped peaches and stir until just combined.
Drop tablespoons of the batter into the muffin tins until half full.
Bake for 35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into a muffin comes out clean.
Cool muffins in tins for 10 minutes, then turn them out onto a wire rack to finish cooling.
Serve immediately or store in an airtight container for up to 2 days.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.
Add the tomatillos to a baking sheet along with the jalapenos and onion wedges. Toss with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil and roast about 7 minutes. Turn the vegetables, add the garlic and roast until everything is slightly softened and charred, another 7 to 8 minutes. Set aside to cool.
Peel the garlic and remove the stems and seeds from the jalapenos. Add the roasted vegetables to the bowl of a food processor and pulse until still slightly chunky but well combined. Add the cilantro, lime juice and 1 teaspoon salt and pulse until incorporated. With the processor running, stream in the remaining 3 tablespoons olive oil until the salsa is slightly runny but not smooth. At this point you can season with additional salt if desired.
Serve with chips or as a salsa for tacos and burritos.
ingredients: 2 pounds fresh tomatillos, husked and well rinsed
1/2 cup loosely packed fresh cilantro leaves

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.
Add the tomatillos to a baking sheet along with the jalapenos and onion wedges.
Toss with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil.
Roast about 7 minutes.
Turn the vegetables, add the garlic and roast until everything is slightly softened and charred, another 7 to 8 minutes.
Set aside to cool.
Peel the garlic and remove the stems and seeds from the jalapenos.
Add the roasted vegetables to the bowl of a food processor and pulse until still slightly chunky but well combined.
Add the cilantro, lime juice and 1 teaspoon salt and pulse until incorporated.
With the processor running, stream in the remaining 3 tablespoons olive oil until the salsa is slightly runny but not smooth.
Season with additional salt if desired.
Serve with chips or as a salsa for tacos and burritos.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Heat canola oil to 350 degrees F. (Drop a very small piece of bread crumb into the oil if it starts to sizzle the oil is hot enough.)
Drain the olives.
Mix flour, garlic powder and chili powder together and place in a shallow dish. Pour eggs into another dish, and bread crumbs with ground black pepper into a third.
Roll the olives in the flour, then roll them in the beaten egg and finally roll them in the bread crumbs. Set on a plate to give the breading a chance to dry and form a crust while the oil heats.
When oil is hot, put half the olives into it, being careful not to drop them and splatter hot oil. Fry until golden brown, then remove and drain on paper towels. Be sure to tip the oil out of the center of the olive. Serve on a platter with Manchego cheese cubes and slices of serrano ham.
ingredients: 10 large or colossal green pitted olives
10 large or colossal black pitted olives

step_by_step_instructions: Heat canola oil to 350 degrees F.
Drain the olives.
Mix flour, garlic powder, and chili powder together and place in a shallow dish.
Pour beaten eggs into another dish.
Mix bread crumbs with ground black pepper in a third dish.
Roll the olives in the flour mixture.
Roll the floured olives in the beaten eggs.
Roll the egg-coated olives in the bread crumbs.
Set the breaded olives on a plate to allow the coating to dry and form a crust.
When the oil is hot, carefully put half the olives into it.
Fry the olives until golden brown.
Remove the fried olives and drain on paper towels, tipping out excess oil from the olives.
Serve the fried olives on a platter with Manchego cheese cubes and slices of serrano ham.

recipe_title: POTATO-HORSERADISH CRUSTED RED SNAPPER WITH ROASTED PEPPER RELISH
original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Season each fillet to taste with salt and pepper. Combine the potato and horseradish and spread the mixture over the top of each fillet, pressing it down so it will adhere.
Heat the oil in a large saute pan over medium heat until almost smoking. Sear each fillet potato-side down until a crust forms, about 3 minutes. Turn the fillets over and finish cooking in the oven until done, about 5 minutes for medium. Place on a large serving platter and top each fillet with some relish. Serve any remaining relish on the side.
In a mixing bowl, combine the bell peppers, olives, pepper flakes, garlic, thyme, parsley, vinegar, honey, and oil. Season to taste with salt and pepper. May be refrigerated up to 1 day. Serve at room temperature.
ingredients: 8 red snapper fillets, 5 to 6 ounces each
1 large potato, peeled and finely grated
2 red bell peppers, roasted, peeled, seeded and diced
2 yellow bell peppers, roasted, peeled, seeded and diced

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Season each fillet to taste with salt and pepper.
Combine the potato and horseradish and spread the mixture over the top of each fillet, pressing it down so it will adhere.
Heat the oil in a large saute pan over medium heat until almost smoking.
Sear each fillet potato-side down until a crust forms, about 3 minutes.
Turn the fillets over and finish cooking in the oven until done, about 5 minutes for medium.
Place on a large serving platter and top each fillet with some relish.
Serve any remaining relish on the side.
In a mixing bowl, combine the bell peppers, olives, pepper flakes, garlic, thyme, parsley, vinegar, honey, and oil.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
May be refrigerated up to 1 day.
Serve at room temperature.

original_instructions: Saute mushrooms in butter in a skillet 5 to 8 minutes over moderate heat until golden. Place all remaining ingredients in a bowl, add mushrooms and toss lightly to mix.
ingredients: 1/2 pound mushrooms, wiped clean and sliced thin

step_by_step_instructions: Saute mushrooms in butter in a skillet over moderate heat until golden, for 5 to 8 minutes.
Place all remaining ingredients in a bowl.
Add mushrooms to the bowl and toss lightly to mix.

original_instructions:
Put the milk and chocolate into an earthenware pot and cook over a low heat until the chocolate has melted. Stir constantly so that it does not stick to the pan.
When the chocolate comes to a boil, lower the heat and beat vigorously with a molinillo until a thick foam rises to the top.
Serve hot in earthenware mugs.

step_by_step_instructions: Put the milk and chocolate into an earthenware pot.
Cook over a low heat until the chocolate has melted.
Stir constantly so that it does not stick to the pan.
When the chocolate comes to a boil, lower the heat.
Beat vigorously with a molinillo until a thick foam rises to the top.
Serve hot in earthenware mugs.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Add all the ingredients to a bowl and mix well. Serve with black pepper potato chips.
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Add all the ingredients to a bowl.
Mix well.
Serve with black pepper potato chips.

original_instructions: In a large bowl, combine cabbage and carrots. In a smaller bowl, make dressing by combining mayonnaise, vinegar, celery seed, sugar, salt and pepper. Toss dressing into cabbage mixture and let chill. Serve in a family style bowl.

In a smaller bowl, make dressing by combining mayonnaise, vinegar, celery seed, sugar, salt, and pepper.
Toss dressing into cabbage mixture and let chill.
Serve in a family style bowl.

original_instructions:
Hollow out 4 tomatoes, . Season with salt and pepper and invert to drain. Cook 2 bacon slices with 1 garlic clove; chop, then toss with 1/2 cup chopped lettuce, 1/2 cup chopped stale bread cubes, 2 tablespoons mayonnaise and salt and pepper. Stuff into the tomatoes, then brush with the bacon drippings. Bake 20 to 30 minutes at 425 degrees F.
Photograph by Antonis Achilleos

Invert the tomatoes to drain.
Cook 2 bacon slices with 1 garlic clove.
Chop the bacon and garlic, then toss with 1/2 cup chopped lettuce, 1/2 cup chopped stale bread cubes, 2 tablespoons mayonnaise, salt and pepper.
Stuff the mixture into the tomatoes.
Brush the stuffed tomatoes with the bacon drippings.
Bake the stuffed tomatoes for 20 to 30 minutes at 425 degrees F.

recipe_title: Black Runner Bean, Rice and Mango Salad
original_instructions: Mix the ingredients together and season with salt and pepper.
ingredients: Up to 1/3 cup dressing of choice made with olive oil, white wine vinegar and toasted chili powder
Salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Mix the cooked beans, cooked rice, celery, mango, red onion, cilantro, and dressing together in a bowl.
Season the mixture with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.

recipe_title: Cafe au Lait Pots de Creme
original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 275 degrees F.
Combine heavy cream, half-and-half, vanilla bean, and sugar in a 1-quart heavy saucepan. Heat over medium-low heat until mixture reaches 180 degrees F. Stir in instant coffee until dissolved. Place egg yolks in a heat-proof bowl and temper the yolks by gradually adding some of the hot cream mixture. Return the egg mixture to the pan with the remaining cream mixture. Stir in the vanilla. Strain custard and then ladle 5 to 6 ounces into 8 custard cups or ramekins. Bake, covered, in a water bath for about 40 minutes or until set. Check at 30 minutes; you may need to reduce the oven temperature to 250 degrees F for the remaining 10 minutes. The centers should not be firm. Cool to room temperature and then refrigerate if not serving right away. Bring to room temperature before serving. Garnish with whipped cream.

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 275 degrees F.
Combine heavy cream, half-and-half, vanilla bean, and sugar in a 1-quart heavy saucepan.
Heat mixture over medium-low heat until it reaches 180 degrees F.
Stir in instant coffee until dissolved.
Place egg yolks in a heat-proof bowl.
Temper the yolks by gradually adding some of the hot cream mixture.
Return the egg mixture to the pan with the remaining cream mixture.
Stir in the vanilla extract.
Strain the custard.
Ladle 5 to 6 ounces into 8 custard cups or ramekins.
Bake, covered, in a water bath for about 40 minutes or until set. Check at 30 minutes; you may need to reduce the oven temperature to 250 degrees F for the remaining 10 minutes.
The centers should not be firm.
Cool to room temperature.
Refrigerate if not serving right away.
Bring to room temperature before serving.
Garnish with whipped cream.

original_instructions: Combine the water, honey, lemon juice and mint leaves in a pitcher. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours to allow the flavors to meld.

step_by_step_instructions: Combine the water, honey, lemon juice, and mint leaves in a pitcher.
Cover the pitcher and refrigerate the mixture for at least 2 hours to allow the flavors to meld.

original_instructions:
Whisk 2 or 3 minced garlic cloves with 2 egg yolks. Gradually whisk in 1 1/2 cups olive oil. Add lemon juice, salt and pepper to taste; thin with water as needed. Serve with crudites.
Olive Aioli
Make Aioli. Stir in 3 tablespoons store-bought olive tapenade.
Orange-Saffron Aioli
Make Aioli with orange juice instead of lemon. Steep 1/2 teaspoon saffron in 2 tablespoons Pernod for 5 minutes, then add to the aioli

step_by_step_instructions: Mince 2 or 3 garlic cloves.
Whisk the minced garlic cloves with 2 egg yolks.
Gradually whisk in 1 1/2 cups of olive oil.
Add lemon juice, salt, and pepper to taste.
Thin with water as needed.
Serve the aioli with crudites.

recipe_title: Chicken Fried Steak and Creamy Gravy
original_instructions: Season steaks with salt and pepper. Reserve 1/4 cup of flour. Dredge each steak in flour, egg and cracker crumbs. In a large cast iron skillet over medium high heat corn oil. Add steaks and cook until golden brown and crisp. Transfer to paper towels to drain. Pour off all but 4 tablespoon remaining oil and set over low heat. Whisk 1/4 flour into hot oil and bring to simmer. Gradually whisk in milk and bring to a simmer. Season with salt and pepper.
ingredients: 2 pounds round steak, cut 1/2-inch thick and pounded with mallet

step_by_step_instructions: Season steaks with salt and pepper.
Reserve 1/4 cup of flour.
Dredge each steak in flour, then egg, then cracker crumbs.
In a large cast iron skillet over medium-high heat, add corn oil.
Add steaks to the skillet and cook until golden brown and crisp.
Transfer steaks to paper towels to drain.
Pour off all but 4 tablespoons of remaining oil and set over low heat.
Whisk 1/4 cup of reserved flour into hot oil and bring to a simmer.
Gradually whisk in milk and bring to a simmer.
Season the sauce with salt and pepper.

recipe_title: New York Strip Steak with Cognac Butter and Portobello Mushroom Ragout
original_instructions:
To prepare the steaks: Rub steaks with garlic clove, salt and cracked pepper. Marinate in Worcestershire sauce for 1 hour, minimum.
To prepare the ragout: Grill mushrooms whole, then coarsely chop into 3/4-inch cubes. Pour olive oil in pan, add mushrooms and shallots, and saute until soft. Add tomatoes, heavy cream, and stock. Simmer and reduce for about 10 minutes. Add herbs and seasonings and remove from heat. Keep warm if using immediately.
To cook steaks and prepare cognac butter: Sear steaks in a heavy skillet on high heat to desired temperature, remove from heat. Add cognac and flame off, then whisk in the butter.
Place mushroom ragout on plate. Cut steaks across the grain into 1/2-inch slices. Fan steaks on top of ragout and drizzle with cognac butter. Garnish as desired. Serve immediately.
ingredients: 4 (12 ounce) NY strip steaks or tenderloin or sirloin steaks

step_by_step_instructions: Rub the steaks with the garlic clove, salt, and cracked pepper.
Marinate the steaks in Worcestershire sauce for 1 hour, minimum.
Grill the mushrooms whole, then coarsely chop them into 3/4-inch cubes.
Pour olive oil into the pan.
Add mushrooms and shallots to the pan and saute until soft.
Add tomatoes, heavy cream, and stock to the pan.
Simmer the mixture and reduce for about 10 minutes.
Add herbs and seasonings, then remove the pan from heat and keep warm if using immediately.
Sear the steaks in a heavy skillet on high heat to the desired temperature, then remove from heat.
Add cognac to the skillet and flame off, then whisk in the butter.
Place the mushroom ragout on a plate.
Cut the steaks across the grain into 1/2-inch slices.
Fan the steak slices on top of the ragout.
Drizzle the steak with cognac butter.
Garnish as desired and serve immediately.

original_instructions: Heat oil in fryer to 350 degrees F. Add French fries to the hot oil (may need to do in separate batches). Shake the basket so they do not stick. Let them reach a golden brown and then drain on paper towels and sprinkle with salt.
ingredients: 2 pounds russet potatoes, peeled and cut into French fries

step_by_step_instructions: Heat oil in fryer to 350 degrees F.
Add French fries to the hot oil. You may need to do this in separate batches.
Shake the basket so the fries do not stick.
Let the fries reach a golden brown color.
Drain the fries on paper towels.
Sprinkle the fries with salt.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Bake the potatoes on a rack for 1 hour or until soft. Allow them to cool slightly.
Cut the potatoes in 1/2, scoop out the pulp, and place in a mixing bowl, setting the skins aside. Add the butter, salt, black pepper, and cayenne. Mash well, adding enough milk to make a fairly stiff mixture. Add the beaten egg yolks and stir well.
Spoon the mixture into the potato skins and top with shredded cheese. Place on a cookie sheet and bake for 20 minutes, until well browned.

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees.
Bake the potatoes on a rack for 1 hour or until soft.
Allow them to cool slightly.
Cut the potatoes in half and scoop out the pulp, placing it in a mixing bowl and setting the skins aside.
Mash the potato pulp with butter, salt, black pepper, and cayenne.
Add enough milk to make a fairly stiff mixture.
Stir in the beaten egg yolks.
Spoon the mixture back into the potato skins.
Top each filled potato skin with shredded cheese.
Place the filled potato skins on a cookie sheet.
Bake for 20 minutes, until well browned.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 10-inch springform pan.
In the top of the double boiler over simmering water, combine the chocolate and butter. Heat until melted and smooth. Transfer to a medium-size bowl and whisk in the egg yolks and vanilla. Sift in the sugar, salt, and cocoa while continuing to whisk.
With a mixer, whip the egg whites to soft peaks. Fold one third of them into the chocolate mixture. Repeat with the remaining whites, then pour the mixture into the prepared pan. Place on the lower rack of the oven and bake for 25 minutes.
Remove to a cake rack and immediately loosen the springform collar (sides). Slip a plate inside the collar on top of the cake and push down slightly to push the air from the cake. Remove the plate and springform collar, and allow the cake to cool before serving.
ingredients: 7 ounces extra bittersweet chocolate (do not use baking chocolate)

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Grease a 10-inch springform pan.
In the top of the double boiler over simmering water, combine the chocolate and butter.
Heat until melted and smooth.
Transfer to a medium-size bowl and whisk in the egg yolks and vanilla.
Sift in the sugar, salt, and cocoa while continuing to whisk.
With a mixer, whip the egg whites to soft peaks.
Fold one third of them into the chocolate mixture.
Repeat with the remaining whites, then pour the mixture into the prepared pan.
Place on the lower rack of the oven and bake for 25 minutes.
Remove to a cake rack and immediately loosen the springform collar (sides).
Slip a plate inside the collar on top of the cake and push down slightly to push the air from the cake.
Remove the plate and springform collar, and allow the cake to cool before serving.

original_instructions:
Make the tuna sauce: Puree the tuna, anchovies, mayonnaise, 2 tablespoons olive oil, the lemon juice and 2 tablespoons water in a blender until smooth.
Place each turkey cutlet between 2 sheets of plastic wrap and pound with a meat mallet or heavy skillet until 1/8 to 1/4 inch thick. Brush with the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Heat a grill pan over medium-high heat and lightly brush with olive oil. Grill the turkey, in batches if necessary, until just cooked through, about 2 minutes per side.
Pile the arugula, tomatoes and capers in the center of the turkey cutlets. Drizzle with half of the tuna sauce and roll up to enclose. Drizzle with the remaining sauce and sprinkle with the basil.
Photograph by Antonis Achilleos
ingredients: 1 5-ounce can tuna packed in olive oil (preferably Italian), drained
3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for brushing
Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Make the tuna sauce: Puree the tuna, anchovies, mayonnaise, 2 tablespoons olive oil, lemon juice and 2 tablespoons water in a blender until smooth.
Place each turkey cutlet between 2 sheets of plastic wrap and pound with a meat mallet or heavy skillet until 1/8 to 1/4 inch thick.
Brush with the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Heat a grill pan over medium-high heat and lightly brush with olive oil.
Grill the turkey, in batches if necessary, until just cooked through, about 2 minutes per side.
Pile the arugula, tomatoes and capers in the center of the turkey cutlets.
Drizzle with half of the tuna sauce and roll up to enclose.
Drizzle with the remaining sauce and sprinkle with basil.

original_instructions:
In a large saucepan over medium heat, heat the olive oil and butter until the oil is shimmering and the butter is melted, about 2 minutes. Add the onion and carrots and saute until the onions are tender, 5 to 8 minutes. Add the mushrooms and rice and cook for 5 minutes more, toasting the rice. Add the garlic.
Add the stock. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low. Add the kale and kohlrabi, cover and simmer until the wild rice is tender, about 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
ingredients: 2 cups (about 12 ounces) fresh cremini mushrooms, quartered
6 cups chicken stock, plus more as needed
1 bunch kale, stemmed and cut into bite-size pieces
1 kohlrabi, peeled and sliced into 1/4-inch half-moons
Salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Heat olive oil and butter in a large saucepan over medium heat until the oil is shimmering and the butter is melted, about 2 minutes.
Add the onion and carrots and saute until the onions are tender, 5 to 8 minutes.
Add the mushrooms and rice and cook for 5 minutes more, toasting the rice.
Add the garlic and chicken stock.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low.
Add the kale and kohlrabi, cover and simmer until the wild rice is tender, about 20 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

original_instructions:
1.In a large mixing bowl, coarsely mash avocados, leaving some chunks.
2.Add the remaining ingredients and mix.
3.Season with salt & pepper.
Serving Suggestions: Serve with fresh, warm tortilla chips.
Beverage Pairings: Try with a locally brewed Southern California beer or a Southern California wine.
ingredients: 7 ripe, Fresh California Avocados, seeded and peeled * (See Cook's Note)

step_by_step_instructions: Coarsely mash avocados in a large mixing bowl, leaving some chunks.
Add chopped cilantro, chopped tomato, chopped red onion, lime juice, cumin, chile powder, chopped roasted poblano chile, and minced garlic to the avocado.
Mix all ingredients together.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Cut the cores from the tomatoes, removing as little as possible. Cut them in half crosswise and, with your fingers, remove the seeds and juice. Place the tomato halves in a baking dish.
In a bowl, combine the bread crumbs, scallions, basil, parsley, garlic, thyme, and 1 teaspoon salt. Sprinkle the tomato halves generously with salt and pepper. With your hands, fill the cavities and cover the tops of the tomatoes with the bread crumb mixture. Bake the tomatoes for 15 minutes, or until they're tender. Sprinkle with the cheese, drizzle with olive oil, and bake for 30 seconds more. Serve hot or at room temperature.
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups fresh white bread crumbs (5 slices, crusts removed)
1/4 cup minced scallions, white and green parts (2 scallions)

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Cut the cores from the tomatoes, removing as little as possible.
Cut the tomatoes in half crosswise and remove the seeds and juice with your fingers.
Place the tomato halves in a baking dish.
In a bowl, combine the bread crumbs, scallions, basil, parsley, garlic, thyme, and 1 teaspoon salt.
Sprinkle the tomato halves generously with salt and pepper.
Fill the cavities and cover the tops of the tomatoes with the bread crumb mixture.
Bake the tomatoes for 15 minutes or until tender.
Sprinkle with cheese, drizzle with olive oil, and bake for 30 seconds more.
Serve hot or at room temperature.

original_instructions: Soak the slices of bread in cold water. When tender, squeeze the bread to express the water. In a food processor puree until smooth the almonds, pepper, cucumbers, vinegar, sugar, scallions and olive oil. Slowly add the ice water until you reach the consistency you like; season to taste with salt and pepper. Chill, covered, until serving time; garnish with cucumber, chives and bell pepper.
ingredients: 3 1inch thick slices French bread, crusts removed
2 ounces blanched whole almonds, roughly chopped
1 green bell pepper, seeded and roughly chopped
3 kirby cucumbers, peeled, seeded and chopped
4 cups (more or less) iced cold water
Salt and freshly ground white pepper
Garnish: seeded finely diced cucumber, chives and finely diced seeded red bell pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Soak the slices of bread in cold water.
When tender, squeeze the bread to express the water.
In a food processor, puree until smooth the almonds, pepper, cucumbers, vinegar, sugar, scallions, and olive oil.
Slowly add the ice water until you reach the desired consistency.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Chill the mixture, covered, until serving time.
Garnish with cucumber, chives, and bell pepper before serving.

recipe_title: Grilled Moroccan Spiced Pork Tenderloin with Creamy Harissa Sauce
original_instructions:
In a small bowl, combine the cinnamon, coriander, cumin, paprika, salt and olive oil. Rub the mixture evenly over the pork tenderloins. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to overnight.
Prepare a grill for high heat cooking. Place the tenderloins on the grill and cook until browned and nicely marked, 8 to 10 minutes. Turn the tenderloins and cook until a meat thermometer inserted into the center of each registers between 155 degrees F and 165 degrees F, 8 to 10 minutes longer. Transfer the tenderloins to a cutting board, tent with foil and let rest for 10 minutes. Slice and serve hot or at room temperature with Creamy Harissa Sauce.
In a small bowl, whisk together the yogurt, lemon juice, oil, harissa and garlic until combined. Season with salt and pepper.
ingredients: Kosher salt and cracked black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: In a small bowl, combine the cinnamon, coriander, cumin, paprika, salt, and olive oil.
Rub the mixture evenly over the pork tenderloins.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to overnight.
Prepare a grill for high heat cooking.
Place the tenderloins on the grill and cook until browned and nicely marked, 8 to 10 minutes.
Turn the tenderloins and cook until a meat thermometer inserted into the center of each registers between 155 degrees F and 165 degrees F, 8 to 10 minutes longer.
Transfer the tenderloins to a cutting board, tent with foil and let rest for 10 minutes.
Slice and serve hot or at room temperature with Creamy Harissa Sauce.
In a small bowl, whisk together the yogurt, lemon juice, oil, harissa and garlic until combined.
Season the sauce with salt and pepper.

recipe_title: Sesame Chicken Sate with Peanut Sauce
original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F.
"Weave" a bamboo skewer through the length of each chicken strip (as you would run a straight pin through fabric). Mix the seeds, chili powder, salt and garlic powder in a shallow bowl. Dip chicken into warm water and roll into seed mixture. Bake on a lightly greased sheet pan until done.
Heat chicken broth. In a mixing bowl, combine peanut butter, Coco Lopez, soy sauce and honey and mix well. It will be thick. Slowly mix chicken broth into peanut butter mixture. It should be medium consistency for dipping skewered chicken.
ingredients: 6 boneless chicken breasts, cut into 1 1/2-inch wide strips

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F.
Weave a bamboo skewer through the length of each chicken strip.
Mix the sesame seeds, chili powder, salt, and garlic powder in a shallow bowl.
Dip chicken strips into warm water and roll into seed mixture.
Bake on a lightly greased sheet pan until done.
Heat chicken broth.
In a mixing bowl, combine peanut butter, Coco Lopez, soy sauce, and honey. Mix well until thick.
Slowly mix the heated chicken broth into the peanut butter mixture until it reaches a medium consistency for dipping.

original_instructions: Combine the butter, garlic, scallions, dill, parsley, lemon juice, salt and pepper in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with a paddle attachment. Beat until mixed, but do not whip.
ingredients: 1/2 pound (2 sticks) unsalted butter, at room temperature
1 tablespoon minced scallions (white and green parts)

step_by_step_instructions: Place the butter, garlic, scallions, dill, parsley, lemon juice, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
Attach the paddle attachment to an electric mixer.
Combine the ingredients by beating them until they are mixed.
Ensure you do not whip the mixture.

original_instructions:
Preheat a grill pan or grill.
Heat the olive oil in a large saute pan over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant. Add the porcini mushrooms and saute until beginning to soften, 5 minutes. Tear the nipitella or other herbs and add to the pan. Add salt and pepper to taste and remove from the heat.
Toast the bread on the grill pan on both sides. Top with the sauteed porcini and garnish with chopped parsley and a drizzle of extra-virgin olive oil. Serve immediately.
ingredients: 3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for drizzling
4 medium porcini mushrooms, stems removed, tops cut into small pieces
2 sprigs fresh nipitella or a combination of fresh baby mint and thyme
1 loaf unsalted Tuscan bread, sliced into 3/4-inch slices
1 small bunch fresh flat-leaf parsley, roughly chopped

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat a grill pan or grill.
Heat the olive oil in a large saute pan over medium-high heat.
Add the garlic and cook until fragrant.
Add the porcini mushrooms and saute until beginning to soften, 5 minutes.
Tear the nipitella or other herbs and add to the pan.
Add salt and pepper to taste and remove from the heat.
Toast the bread on the grill pan on both sides.
Top with the sauteed porcini.
Garnish with chopped parsley and a drizzle of extra-virgin olive oil.
Serve immediately.

original_instructions: Combine the orange, cranberry, and pineapple juices in a large container. Add the 2 vodkas and the halved fruits to the punch. Transfer to the refrigerator and chill over night.

step_by_step_instructions: Combine the orange, cranberry, and pineapple juices in a large container.
Add the vodkas and the halved fruits to the punch.
Transfer to the refrigerator and chill overnight.

original_instructions:
1. Pour 1/4 cup Wish-Bone® Italian Dressing over chicken in large, shallow nonaluminum baking dish or plastic bag. Cover, or close bag, and marinate in refrigerator, turning occasionally, 30 minutes to 3 hours.
2. Meanwhile, combine tomatoes, onion, basil and 1/4 cup Dressing in medium bowl. Cover and marinate in refrigerator at least 30 minutes.
3. Remove chicken from marinade, discarding marinade. Grill or broil chicken, turning once and brushing frequently with remaining 1/4 cup Dressing, until chicken is thoroughly cooked, about 12 minutes. Serve tomato mixture over chicken.
For Marinated Chicken with Fresh Salsa, use cilantro instead of basil.
Cost per recipe*: $10.49.
Cost per serving*: $1.75.
*Based on average retail prices at national supermarkets.
ingredients: 6 boneless, skinless chicken breast halves (about 1-1/2 lbs.)
1 Tbsp. finely chopped fresh basil leaves* (optional)

step_by_step_instructions: Pour 1/4 cup Italian dressing over chicken in a large, shallow nonaluminum baking dish or plastic bag.
Cover or close the bag, and marinate in the refrigerator, turning occasionally, for 30 minutes to 3 hours.
Meanwhile, combine tomatoes, onion, basil, and 1/4 cup Italian dressing in a medium bowl.
Cover and marinate the tomato mixture in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
Remove chicken from marinade, discarding marinade.
Grill or broil chicken, turning once and brushing frequently with the remaining 1/4 cup Italian dressing, until chicken is thoroughly cooked, about 12 minutes.
Serve the tomato mixture over the cooked chicken.

original_instructions:
To make the aioli: Beat the yolk with the vinegar and mustard in a bowl. Whisk in the oil, drop by drop, to make a thick mayonnaise. Squeeze the garlic out of the roasted cloves into the mayonnaise and whisk smooth. Season the aioli with salt, pepper, and lemon juice, to taste.
To prepare the artichokes: Trim the artichokes, rubbing with lemon as you go, until you are down to the core with a bit of stem attached. Halve. While you're trimming, bring a pot of water to the boil. Squeeze the juice of a lemon into it and salt it. Drop in the artichokes and cook until tender, about 10 minutes, depending on the size. Drain, and pat dry. Heat the olive oil in a skillet and brown the artichokes on all sides. Transfer to paper towel to drain. Serve with the aioli.
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
12 baby artichokes (poivrade variety, which are the tiny ones)

step_by_step_instructions: Beat the yolk with the vinegar and mustard in a bowl.
Whisk in the oil, drop by drop, to make a thick mayonnaise.
Squeeze the garlic out of the roasted cloves into the mayonnaise and whisk until smooth.
Season the aioli with salt, pepper, and lemon juice to taste.
Trim the artichokes, rubbing with lemon as you go, until you are down to the core with a bit of stem attached.
Halve the artichokes.
While trimming, bring a pot of water to the boil.
Squeeze the juice of a lemon into the boiling water and salt it.
Drop in the artichokes and cook until tender, about 10 minutes.
Drain the artichokes and pat them dry.
Heat the olive oil in a skillet and brown the artichokes on all sides.
Transfer the artichokes to a paper towel to drain.
Serve the artichokes with the aioli.

original_instructions: Trim mushroom stems. If you are using shiitakes or portobellos and stems are not too tough, separate stems from caps and cut stems into thin slivers. First braise them in broth for 10 minutes before sauteing to tenderize stems. Keep caps whole or coarsely slice. If using cultivated mushrooms, simply trim 1/4-inch off of bottom stem; wipe caps with damp cloth of brush and slice coarsely. Heat oil or butter in large wide skillet and saute shallots for a minute. Add mushroom slices or mushroom caps and saute just over high heat until browned. (If appropriate, add stems and broth and evaporate over high heat.) Season to taste with salt and pepper and add herbs if you wish. To serve spoon over grilled chicken; use as base for tortellini soup or pizza topping.
ingredients: 1 pound cultivated, shiitake, or portobello mushrooms (choose one or several types)
1/2 cup chicken broth, optional for braising stems
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
2 tablespoons chopped fresh herbs like parsley or tarragon, optional

step_by_step_instructions: Trim the mushroom stems.
If using portobellos and stems are not too tough, separate stems from caps and cut stems into thin slivers.
Braise stems in broth for 10 minutes before sautéing to tenderize.
Keep mushroom caps whole or coarsely slice.
If using cultivated mushrooms, trim 1/4-inch off the bottom of the stem and wipe caps with a damp cloth or brush.
Slice mushrooms coarsely.
Heat oil or butter in a large wide skillet.
Sauté shallots for a minute.
Add mushroom slices or caps and sauté over high heat until browned.
If appropriate, add stems and broth mixture and evaporate over high heat.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add herbs if desired.
Serve over grilled chicken, or use as a base for tortellini soup or pizza topping.

original_instructions:
In a food processor grate the potatoes. Line a sieve with cheesecloth and transfer potatoes to the sieve. Set sieve over a bowl, twist cheesecloth into a pouch, squeezing out some moisture. Let mixture drain for 15 minutes. After 15 minutes, pour off liquid from the bowl but leave the white potato starch that settles in the bottom of the bowl.
To that starch add eggs, flour,herbs, 1-1/2 teaspoons of salt and freshly ground pepper. Return drained potatoes to this mixture and toss to combine.
Preheat oven to 200 degrees. Line a baking pan with paper towels. When you are ready to eat, in a large skillet heat 1/4 inch of oil over medium high heat until hot. Drop heaping tablespoonfuls of potato mixture and cook for 3 to 4 minutes a side; latkes should be golden and crisp on both sides. Eat right away or keep warm in oven.
Serve topped with slivers of roasted red peppers,and salsa.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons flour (or more) or matzo meal (during Passover)
2 tablespoons chopped herbs such as cilantro,
1 1/2 teaspoons salt and freshly ground black pepper
Rasoted red peppers and salsa for garnish

step_by_step_instructions: Grate the potatoes in a food processor.
Line a sieve with cheesecloth and transfer grated potatoes to the sieve.
Place the sieve over a bowl, twist cheesecloth into a pouch and squeeze out some moisture from the potatoes.
Let the mixture drain for 15 minutes.
After 15 minutes, pour off liquid from the bowl but leave the potato starch at the bottom.
Add eggs, flour, herbs, salt, and pepper to the potato starch.
Return the drained potatoes to this mixture and toss to combine.
Preheat the oven to 200 degrees.
Line a baking pan with paper towels.
In a large skillet, heat 1/4 inch of oil over medium-high heat until hot.
Drop heaping tablespoonfuls of potato mixture into the hot oil.
Cook for 3 to 4 minutes on each side until golden and crisp.
Eat the latkes right away or keep warm in the oven.
Serve topped with slivers of roasted red peppers and salsa.

original_instructions:
Toss the cucumber, vinegar, sugar and 2 teaspoons salt in a medium bowl and set aside at room temperature, tossing occasionally, until juicy, about 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, put the almonds in a large skillet and heat over medium, swirling them around until golden and toasted in spots, about 3 minutes. Set aside to cool.
Add the oil and garlic, the cucumber mixture along with any collected juices, 6 ice cubes and all but 2 tablespoons each of the almonds and parsley to a blender. Blend on high until very smooth. Refrigerate until chilled, about 2 hours.
Pour into 2-ounce shot glasses. Sprinkle each with the reserved almonds and parsley.
ingredients: 3 large cucumbers, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch chunks
1/2 small bunch parsley, leaves roughly chopped

step_by_step_instructions: Toss the cucumber, vinegar, sugar and 2 teaspoons salt in a medium bowl and set aside at room temperature, tossing occasionally, until juicy, about 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, put the almonds in a large skillet and heat over medium, swirling them around until golden and toasted in spots, about 3 minutes.
Set almonds aside to cool.
Add the oil, garlic, the cucumber mixture along with any collected juices, 6 ice cubes and all but 2 tablespoons each of the almonds and parsley to a blender.
Blend on high until very smooth.
Refrigerate until chilled, about 2 hours.
Pour into 2-ounce shot glasses.
Sprinkle each with the reserved almonds and parsley.

original_instructions: Cook bacon in microwave oven or on stove top. Let cool and crumble into medium bowl. Add onion, parsley and bread crumbs. Chop up clams and add to breadcrumb mixture. Moisten with reserved clam liquor. Season with salt, pepper, squirt of lemon and a dash of Tabasco sauce. Fill clam shells with mixture and place in a baking dish. Top clams with dots of butter and more bread crumbs. Broil until browned. Serve.

step_by_step_instructions: Cook bacon in a microwave oven or on the stove top.
Let the bacon cool and crumble it into a medium bowl.
Add the chopped onion, chopped parsley, and fresh bread crumbs to the bowl.
Chop up the clams and add them to the breadcrumb mixture.
Moisten the mixture with the reserved clam liquor.
Season with salt, pepper, a squirt of lemon, and a dash of Tabasco sauce.
Fill clam shells with the mixture and place them in a baking dish.
Top the clams with dots of butter and more bread crumbs.
Broil until browned.
Serve.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Trim about 1 inch off the ends of the broccoli stalks and cut the broccoli lengthwise into spears. Arrange the broccoli on a nonstick cookie sheet, drizzle with some olive oil and season with a little bit of salt and a generous amount of freshly ground black pepper. Toss to coat evenly. Transfer to the oven and roast for 10 minutes.
Remove the broccoli from the oven and sprinkle the cheese evenly over the top and bake until the cheese melt and forms a crisp shell over the broccoli, about 10 minutes. Lift the broccoli out onto a platter with a spatula and drizzle with fresh lemon.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Trim about 1 inch off the ends of the broccoli stalks and cut the broccoli lengthwise into spears.
Arrange the broccoli on a nonstick cookie sheet.
Drizzle with some olive oil and season with a little bit of salt and a generous amount of freshly ground black pepper.
Toss to coat the broccoli evenly.
Transfer to the oven and roast for 10 minutes.
Remove the broccoli from the oven and sprinkle the cheese evenly over the top.
Bake until the cheese melts and forms a crisp shell over the broccoli, about 10 minutes.
Lift the broccoli out onto a platter with a spatula.
Drizzle with fresh lemon juice.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 250 degrees F.
Heat 2 teaspoons of the oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Whisk together the eggs, milk, salt, and black pepper. Pour half of mixture into hot skillet. When egg starts to cook, lift edges with a spatula to allow uncooked egg to slide underneath. When almost cooked through, top 1 half with desired toppings. Fold over untopped side and cook 2 minutes, until egg is cooked through and cheese melts (if using cheese). Transfer omelet to a baking sheet and place in a warm oven while you prepare second omelet.
Slice omelets in half and serve.
ingredients: 8 slices turkey bacon, cooked until crisp (in the microwave or skillet)
1/2 cup diced tomatoes or leftover tomatoes

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 250 degrees F.
Heat 2 teaspoons of oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Whisk together eggs, milk, salt, and black pepper.
Pour half of the mixture into the hot skillet.
When the egg starts to cook, lift edges with a spatula to allow uncooked egg to slide underneath.
When almost cooked through, top one half with desired toppings.
Fold over untopped side and cook for 2 minutes, until egg is cooked through and cheese melts if using.
Transfer omelet to a baking sheet and place in a warm oven while preparing the second omelet.
Slice omelets in half and serve.

recipe_title: Aida's Corn, Tomato and Avocado Salad
original_instructions:
Combine the dressing ingredients in a blender, using 2 teaspoons salt, and pepper to taste; process until smooth. Combine the salad ingredients in a large bowl and toss with the dressing. Let sit at least 15 minutes before serving, or cover and refrigerate for up to 4 hours.
Photography by Kate Sears
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Combine 2 teaspoons of salt, pepper, fresh cilantro, extra-virgin olive oil, fresh lime juice, and finely grated lime zest in a blender.
Blend the mixture until smooth to form the dressing.
In a large bowl, combine corn kernels, halved grape tomatoes, diced fresh mozzarella, and diced avocados.
Toss the salad ingredients with the prepared dressing.
Let the salad sit for at least 15 minutes before serving, or cover and refrigerate for up to 4 hours.

original_instructions:
Sift the flour with the salt, and knead into a soft dough by adding the yogurt, butter, and water.
Cover with a moist cloth and let rise for 1/2 an hour.
Meanwhile, combine ingredients for the potato filling in a bowl and refrigerate until needed.
Knead the dough again, and divide into 8 equal parts, rolling them into small balls. Using a rolling pin, roll out each ball into a round disc approximately 3 inches in diameter.
Place the potato filling in the center of 4 of them, cover with the remaining disks, and roll out into a 4 to 5 inch discs. Brush the breads with soft butter.
Place the stuffed breads on non-stick or well-seasoned cast iron pan on medium-high heat. They can also be cooked on a charcoal grill or pancake griddle. Cook till both sides are golden brown, approximately 2 to 3 minutes per side.
ingredients: 1 potato, baked, cooled, peeled and mashed

step_by_step_instructions: Sift the flour with the salt.
Knead into a soft dough by adding the yogurt, butter, and water.
Cover the dough with a moist cloth and let it rise for 30 minutes.
Combine the ingredients for the potato filling in a bowl and refrigerate until needed.
Knead the dough again and divide into 8 equal parts, rolling them into small balls.
Using a rolling pin, roll out each ball into a round disc approximately 3 inches in diameter.
Place the potato filling in the center of 4 discs, cover with the remaining discs and roll out into 4 to 5 inch discs.
Brush the stuffed breads with soft butter.
Place the stuffed breads on a non-stick or well-seasoned cast iron pan on medium-high heat.
Cook till both sides are golden brown, approximately 2 to 3 minutes per side.

original_instructions:
Glaze: Add all the ingredients to a small bowl and stir until smooth. Set the bowl aside.
Cake: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Lightly grease a Bundt pan or tube pan.
In a bowl, mix together the apples, walnuts, vanilla, and cinnamon. In a separate bowl, sift together the flour, baking soda, and salt.
Using an electric mixer beat the sugar, oil, and eggs in a large bowl. Add in the dry ingredients and beat until completely combined. Fold in the apple mixture.
Scrape the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 1 hour and 30 minutes or until a tester inserted into the middle of the cake comes out clean.
Allow the cake to fully cool in the pan, about 1 hour, and then turn it out onto a plate.
Drizzle the apple cake with some of the honey glaze, serve and enjoy!
ingredients: 3 cups diced Granny Smith apples, about 2 apples

step_by_step_instructions: Add confectioners' sugar, honey, and milk to a small bowl and stir until smooth. Set aside.
Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F.
Lightly grease a Bundt pan or tube pan.
In a bowl, mix together apples, walnuts, vanilla, and cinnamon.
In a separate bowl, sift together flour, baking soda, and salt.
Using an electric mixer, beat sugar, oil, and eggs in a large bowl.
Add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture and beat until completely combined.
Fold in the apple mixture.
Scrape the batter into the prepared pan.
Bake for 1 hour and 30 minutes or until a tester inserted in the middle of the cake comes out clean.
Allow the cake to fully cool in the pan for about 1 hour.
Turn the cake out onto a plate.
Drizzle the apple cake with the honey glaze and serve.

original_instructions: In a small saucepan combine the corn syrup and heavy cream. Bring to a simmer and add the chocolate. Stir until smooth. Remove from the heat and add the vanilla extract.
ingredients: 12 ounces dark chocolate, chopped into small pieces

step_by_step_instructions: In a small saucepan, combine the corn syrup and heavy cream.
Bring to a simmer and add the chocolate.
Stir until smooth.
Remove from the heat and add the vanilla extract.

original_instructions: In a bowl combine cornmeal, Cheddar, onion, bell pepper, salt, and cayenne. Stir in boiling water and mix thoroughly. In a deep heavy pan or deep fryer heat 3 inches of vegetable oil to 350 F. Drop 6 spoonfuls of the batter into the oil and fry for 2 to 3 minutes or until golden brown. Transfer fritters to paper towels to drain. Season with additional salt if desired. Serve warm with hot sauce.;
ingredients: Louisiana-style hot sauce, for example Crystal brand

step_by_step_instructions: In a bowl combine cornmeal, Cheddar, onion, bell pepper, salt, and cayenne.
Stir in boiling water and mix thoroughly.
In a deep heavy pan or deep fryer, heat 3 inches of vegetable oil to 350 F.
Drop 6 spoonfuls of the batter into the oil and fry for 2 to 3 minutes or until golden brown.
Transfer fritters to paper towels to drain.
Season with additional salt if desired.
Serve warm with hot sauce.
required_tools: deep heavy pan or deep fryer

original_instructions: Spread bean dip on a flour tortilla, top with shredded cheddar and roll up. Brush with vegetable oil and bake 10 minutes at 400 degrees F. Serve with salsa.

step_by_step_instructions: Spread bean dip on a flour tortilla.
Top with shredded cheddar.
Roll up the tortilla.
Brush with vegetable oil.
Bake for 10 minutes at 400 degrees F.
Serve with salsa.

original_instructions: Cut a stencil out of a plastic coffee can lid in the shape of a 3-inch disk. Whip the egg whites until stiff and chill. In a mixer, cream the butter, then add the sugar and continue mixing. Add the flour and blend in, then add the vanilla and blend again. Add the chilled egg whites and mix on low until well incorporated and the batter is smooth. With a small offset spatula, spread batter through the stencil so it is a circle onto a silpat or parchment paper, about 6 per cookie sheet. Bake in a preheated 350-degree oven until light golden brown, 7 to 8 minutes. Quickly remove the pan from the oven and one at time place a fortune across the center with a bit hanging out. Fold cookie circle in thirds over fortune with flaps only slightly overlapping each other. Turn over and bring opposing sides together and pinch. Let cool.

step_by_step_instructions: Cut a stencil out of a plastic coffee can lid in the shape of a 3-inch disk.
Whip the egg whites until stiff and chill.
In a mixer, cream the butter.
Add the sugar to the creamed butter and continue mixing.
Add the flour and blend in.
Add the vanilla and blend again.
Add the chilled egg whites and mix on low until well incorporated and the batter is smooth.
With a small offset spatula, spread batter through the stencil so it is a circle onto a silpat or parchment paper, about 6 per cookie sheet.
Bake in a preheated 350-degree oven until light golden brown, 7 to 8 minutes.
Quickly remove the pan from the oven and one at a time place a fortune across the center with a bit hanging out.
Fold cookie circle in thirds over fortune with flaps only slightly overlapping each other.
Turn over and bring opposing sides together and pinch.
Let cool.

original_instructions:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
Beat together cookie dough and peanut butter in large bowl until blended and smooth. Stir or knead in mini chips, peanut butter chips and peanuts until evenly distributed.
Drop 1 heaping tablespoon of dough for each cookie onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 15 minutes. Cool slightly on baking sheets. Then transfer to wire rack and cool.
ingredients: 1 package (about 18 ounces) prepared sugar cookie dough

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, beat together the cookie dough and peanut butter until blended and smooth.
Stir or knead in mini chocolate chips, peanut butter chips, and peanuts until evenly distributed.
Drop 1 heaping tablespoon of dough for each cookie onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes.
Cool the cookies slightly on the baking sheets.
Transfer the cookies to a wire rack to cool completely.

recipe_title: Rajas de Chiles y Queso Manchego
original_instructions:
Over a medium high heat, in a medium-size cast iron skillet, heat the oil until it smokes. Add the whole epazote leaves and fry until they wilt, stirring all the time, about 2 minutes. Add the chile strips and salt and fry about 3 minutes, stirring all the time.
Reduce the heat to low. Stir in the cream and milk. Add the pieces of cheese and cook until the cheese melts.
Serve hot, over Arroz Blanco.
ingredients: 9 poblano or Anaheim chiles, roasted, peeled, seeded, and cut in strips
1 teaspoon sea salt, or to taste
12 ounces Queso Manchego or Muenster cheese, cut into thick slices

step_by_step_instructions: Over a medium high heat, in a medium-size cast iron skillet, heat the oil until it smokes.
Add the whole epazote leaves and fry until they wilt, stirring all the time, about 2 minutes.
Add the chile strips and salt and fry about 3 minutes, stirring all the time.
Reduce the heat to low.
Stir in the cream and milk.
Add the pieces of cheese and cook until the cheese melts.
Serve hot, over Arroz Blanco.

recipe_title: Arugula Salad with White Truffle Oil, Marcona Almonds and Shaved Parmesan
original_instructions:
Whisk together the lemon juice, mustard and some salt and pepper in a large bowl; slowly whisk in the olive oil.
Add the arugula, almonds and raisins and toss gently to coat. Transfer to a serving platter. Drizzle with the truffle oil, scatter the Parmesan on top and serve.
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Whisk together the lemon juice, mustard, salt, and pepper in a large bowl.
Slowly whisk in the olive oil.
Add the arugula, almonds, and raisins to the bowl and toss gently to coat.
Transfer the salad to a serving platter.
Drizzle with truffle oil.
Scatter Parmesan on top.
Serve.

original_instructions:
Vanilla Dough preparation:
Beat cake mix, oil, melted butter, egg, and vanilla in large bowl until dough forms. Stir in walnuts.
Chocolate Dough preparation:
Beat cake mix, oil, melted butter, egg, and vanilla in large bowl until dough forms. Stir in walnuts.
Cookie preparation:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Scoop 1 teaspoon of vanilla dough into ball. Scoop 1 teaspoon of chocolate dough into ball. Gently press dough balls together, then roll gently to form one ball. Place 20 balls on an ungreased baking sheet, spaced evenly apart. Bake for 10 minutes, or just until cookies begin to brown. Cool cookies on cookie sheets for 5 minutes. Transfer cookies to cooling racks and cool completely. Repeat with remaining chocolate and vanilla dough, forming about 6 dozen cookies total. Store in airtight container at room temperature up to 2 days, or freeze up to 3 months.

step_by_step_instructions: Vanilla Dough preparation: Beat cake mix, oil, melted butter, egg, and vanilla in a large bowl until dough forms. Stir in walnuts.
Chocolate Dough preparation: Beat cake mix, oil, melted butter, egg, and vanilla in a large bowl until dough forms. Stir in walnuts.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Scoop 1 teaspoon of vanilla dough into a ball.
Scoop 1 teaspoon of chocolate dough into a ball.
Gently press dough balls together, then roll gently to form one ball.
Place 20 balls on an ungreased baking sheet, spaced evenly apart.
Bake for 10 minutes, or just until cookies begin to brown.
Cool cookies on cookie sheets for 5 minutes.
Transfer cookies to cooling racks and cool completely.
Repeat with remaining chocolate and vanilla dough, forming about 6 dozen cookies total.
Store in an airtight container at room temperature up to 2 days, or freeze up to 3 months.

original_instructions:
Combine the yogurt, olive oil, lemon zest and juice, rosemary, salt, and pepper in a large non-reactive bowl. Add the lamb, making sure it is covered with marinade. Marinate in the refrigerator, covered, overnight or for up to 3 days.
